title: Real Madrid 'targeting Unai Simon to replace Thibaut Courtois'
text:
And now the Belgian goalkeeper could reportedly find himself being replaced

He's not been hit with Madrid fans since move from Chelsea in summer of 2018

Real Madrid are reportedly targeting Atheltic Bilbao's Unai Simon to replace Thibaut Courtois in goal.

The Belgian's form has again come under scrutiny this season and he has not been a hit with Madrid fans since his move from Chelsea in the summer of 2018.

And now Courtois could find himself being replaced as Madrid are interested in Simon, according to El Desmarque.

Real Madrid are reportedly targeting Atheltic Bilbao's Unai Simon to replace Thibaut Courtois

The Bilbao No 1 has a contract until 2023 and reportedly has a £43million buy-out clause in that deal.

In 10 matches this season Courtois has conceded 12 goals and kept just three clean sheets while Simon has let in four goals and had four shut outs in eight games.

Courtois did keep a clean sheet in Zinedine Zidane's side's Champions League group-stage win over Galatasaray on Tuesday night.
